Record.Description: Any substance used to prevent eye and nerve damage in diabetes. Aldose reductase (EC 1.1.1.21) is a member of the monomeric, NADPH-dependent aldoketoreductase family and participates in glucose metabolism and osmoregulation. It is the first enzyme of the polyol pathway of sugar metabolism, is most abundantly expressed in adrenal gland, and has been implicated in diabetic complications. (from OMIM)
